website_summaries.verdict: Variable sizes offered to ensure proper filtration for your tank. Moves a lot of water very efficiently.
pros: Customers love the power of this filter and its performance level
Uses three different methods of filtration
Maintains flow of water, even with dirty filters
cons: Owners report some setups run extremely noisily
Some owners report problems with longevity for the system

customer_reviews.title: Noise! Noise! Grrrrrrr! Make it shut up..I hate this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Noise! Noise! How do I make it shut up? Update- December 16, 2017 Had it since November and I want to return it. I set up the aquarium to relax, not to GRRRRR, GRRRR, GRGGGGRRRRR....
customer_reviews.author: ioji

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I've had several tanks over the years ranging from 2.5 gallons to my current 40. And have always used Aqueon QuietFlows, which were never really quiet. My newest QuietFlow broke after 2 day so, going from the reviews, I decided to try the AquaClear 70 and I am blown away at how much better I like. It's very quiet except for a minimal hum, you can't hear the water splashing into the tank, the stream is strong but not so strong that it moves the sand around and it seems to be doing a great job of filtering my 40 gallon. The cover fits very snug and there is no rattle. Absolutely worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: dcc

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it but....
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this filter. Set up was simple. I loved how big the chamber is for the filter media. It is really loud for me. It is louder than my air pump that I was trying to replace. I will give it some more time but I think that I will be taking this off of my tank. I will update if something changes.
customer_reviews.author: Patrice Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit my tank
customer_reviews.text: I just received Aquaclear 70 for my 72 gallon bowfront tank. I already have Marineland 350 and 2 sponge filters. Lately the airstone has been making too much noise so I decided to add another HOB and get rid of the sponge filters. I should have gotten another Marineland 350 because Aquaclear 70 will not fit my tank like Marineland would. They should have designed the filter better so it sits better. It is not going all the way down and is splashing water to my glass top. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kang Wook Lee

customer_reviews.title: Leaks water!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to live this filter. Great reviews great volume. BUT no matter what I've tried it leaks water onto the floor. First time I came in and it popped the top lid off and water was flowing over. I decided to tape the lid down but it continued to leak out the top. Next I removed the middle carbon filter to try to make more room and only have it at half flow. I went in today and notice the water level was down and sure enough it was leaking again. Looks like I'm going to have to try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter!
customer_reviews.text: I was using a Tetra in-tank filter previously...I was new to the hobby and didn't realize that Tetras were inferior filters. Then I bought the Aquaclear 50 and instantly understood what the positive reviews were about. This lives up to the praise that people give it. Runs quiet, pushes tons of water, customizable media options, and it's not an eyesore. One piece of advice...if you have a tall tank, get the intake extender(s). You'll want to pull that water from the bottom. Also, a sponge pre-filter is helpful to keep large debris and small critters from getting sucked into the tube.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Damaged and disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The impeller came out of the box with a broken fin. I have used Aqua Clear filters for years and have never had a problem until this particular purchase. Per the instructions I attempted to call the 1-800 number included in the instructions as well as contact them via their web site but could not reach Aqua Clear through either method. I installed the impeller as is, because I can't lose anymore time without a filter. So far it is working fine, however I do not like the fact that I cannot contact customer service about the damaged impeller. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Scott LakeTop Contributor: Ukuleles

customer_reviews.title: Best off the back aquarium filters
customer_reviews.text: This off the back filter is been used on a small 1 gallon nano. A little over-kill; I have the flow adjustment set to the lowest setting. But best thing about this compared to most other off the back filters is that u don’t have to search and buy those proprietary filter cartridges. U just clean the sponge, toss in a carbon bag, and a bio bag. Done. I have used these aqua-clear filters for many years and this one performs just as well as the larger versions.
customer_reviews.author: Islandwrath

customer_reviews.title: Pros & Cons
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a total of at least 5 of these filters. I used 2 aqua clear 70 on a 110 gallon tank so keep that in mind. Pro: The filter works extremely well and is easy to set up. I received multiple compliments on how clear my aquarium water is. Con: If you have a power lost or blow a fuse the filter will burn itself out quick. You will HAVE to replace it. I have replaced 4 filters in about 4 years due to power outages. ***Get a back up battery with this filter or get another type of filter***
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Plenty

customer_reviews.title: Good, quiet, efficient
customer_reviews.text: Runs great! Purchased one of these in 2017, worked great for about 1.5 yrs until we lost power, which killed the motor. Was able to get it to run after a little longer after fixing it myself, until another power outage totally killed it. After some research, reorder a second one as it really is a great filter and seems levels above the rest + I liked it so much. So far it’s been 3 months w/ the new filter and It’s been running smoothly, quietly, and I haven’t had to do any maintenance yet. Really love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mich

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 4 stars instead of 5 because it came to me all scuffed up, with some sand on it. It smelt new, but it is very scratched up. This product sells for $15 more in my local stores, so this was a very good deal, I think. It's doing its job great, I am very happy with this filter. This is on a brand new tank I am working on, and it cleared the water very quickly after I added sand and Flourite black. I cant stress that the product works great but I was caught by surprise when I saw it scratched inside the box. No big deal though.
customer_reviews.author: Nay

customer_reviews.title: Best HOB filter available
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite HOB filters. It’s so nice to be able to pull the entire basket out and rinse the sponge. I use a refillable media bag for charcoal. I also use Polyfil from the hobby store to catch the micro pieces of debris- it really polished the water and makes it very clear. I bought this one for a planted 10 gallon tank with guppies and shrimp. I also have these filters on a 29 gallon tank and a 75 gallon tank. I run a total of 5 of these on my multiple tanks. I wouldn’t run another brand! Price is the best on Amazon- have not found it better anywhere else. Don’t hesitate, buy this filter!
customer_reviews.author: Jacquiejones10

customer_reviews.title: Two filters in two years, broke the exact same way. Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: Super bummed.. these are highly reviewed filters, and yet I've gone through two and had the same result.. after about 7-10 months of normal use and regular cleaning, the motor gets hot and stops spinning the little propeller that sucks the water in. Motor still makes a noise, but nothing happens. I loved this filter while it lasted, but having to replace it at least once a year isn't worth it. We have other filters that have lasted 2.5 yrs and still running perfectly with the same care and maintenance, so it's definitely not what we are doing. Not going with these again!
customer_reviews.author: HHarmon

customer_reviews.title: Great While it Lasted
customer_reviews.text: Love, super powerful filtration. My tank stays cleaner longer. I am purchasing a second one for my new 29gal tank which will house goldfish. Update 8/21/18 - It just suddenly stopped working! And I didn't keep the box, so not sure if I can even get the mfg warranty :( Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Dashing Diva

customer_reviews.title: Great but there was an issue
customer_reviews.text: First, I must say this this is one of, if not the best HOB filter on the market. But the intake tube (The one that loops around the top to attach to the motor, was cracked and was basically invisible. Didn't know why the filter couldnt suck water until I realized it couldnt pull it as it was also pullin air from the crack. Had to buy a replacement that was cheap and works great with it.
customer_reviews.author: James Marinelli

customer_reviews.title: great filter
customer_reviews.text: not silent but reasonably quiet for the size. I have it in a 50 gallon tank (which is admittedly slightly overstocked) and it's doing an amazing job. my 12yr old cory cats actually started laying eggs again! so I know everyone is happy. the only complaints- the first one I ordered made a grinding noise at the impeller, I took the whole thing apart, cleaned/cleared everything out with no change. returned that one hassle free and the second is much better. the other downside is the slots on the intake are pretty huge, fine for me but would definitely be an issue in a shrimp tank.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I liked the set up, didn't care for the water flow as it said it could be toned down (I have Betas) and it really didn't do much there, but is quiet. My problem is mine ran about a week now just will not pick up water I can prime all I want the water is not going to pick up
customer_reviews.author: Sandra O.

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet and High Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I got a 20 filter for my 10 gallon tank. Very easy setup with easy to read instructions. Comes with all the filter components! I love how I can alter the water flow. I turn it on low during feeding so less food floats to the bottom of the tank. It is also so quiet!! I can still hear some of the water flow, but I personally find the sound very relaxing. It can be hard to put the filter components inside it, but it only takes a good push. The only con is that the plastic pieced used to level the tank falls off and is completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: GLS

customer_reviews.title: Great filter that allows flexibility in filtration media, easy to make quieter
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers have discussed in detail all of the merits of this filter, so I will not cover that. The only (small) downside I found with this filter (the 50g version in my case) seems to vary from unit to unit: it isn't always very quiet, which can be a problem if the aquarium is in your bedroom. However, this is easy to fix if you search for "quieting the Aquaclear filter." With some teflon tape and silicone lubricant, I was able to nearly silence the motor on the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Dog-Lover

customer_reviews.title: NOT HAPPY..VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: Let me tell you honestly what I think of this product.i hate writing a bad review.it makes me feel terrible. However I feel it n eccesary to let other people know what has happened to me I purchased this product back in sept.of 2019.was EXTREMELY HAPPY WITH it up till now.after only what 3 and a half months,it's making weird noises??what the heck!! I am not at all new to fish keeping,however it is the first aqua clear filter I have ever bought.i am not happy.Just sayin.i am a senior who doesn't have 40.00 laying around to go buy another one after only 5 months of use.pretty sad!!!!
customer_reviews.author: murphy

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Should of never waited to buy. Will suck up baby fish and get clogged with plant matter if you have live plants so get a screen. Cheap to maintain and works beautifully with no noise. Most reviews and YouTube videos say they don't restart after a power outage but mine does, 8 outages so far and never had to do a thing to it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality control
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 of the aquaclear filters one broke so I orders this one, the part that connects the inflow U shape is not straight so it does not pull water for full flow, I always liked these filters maybe I got a dud, but if it was my first time I would never buy these again. Lucky me I had a spare part from the broke filter
customer_reviews.author: marissa

customer_reviews.title: Got it for a steal at $34.40 cheaper than the AquaClear 50 sadly no longer
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a steal for $34.40 now looking at it the next day they raise the price to $49 I love the ability for this filter to clean it does have one issue with the top magnifying the noise of the pump. I took the lid off and put it on slightly crooked not all the way in and it's quiet now. Supposedly it will get quieter overtime but this filter does a very good job cleaning
customer_reviews.author: MitsuGuy67

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and service
customer_reviews.text: Works fine and is easy to customize. I'm using it in a 10 gallon and it keeps everything clean. A couple of days ago it stopped working. Wasn't really sure why. Figured I got a dud and would need to get another one. Looked up and found a YouTube video detailing how to remove and check the impeller. Pulling the motor out was easy, as was removing he impeller. I cleaned that out and sure enough everything started working again. Would definitely encourage you getting a foam cover for the water intake.
customer_reviews.author: B. Austin

customer_reviews.title: So far so......
customer_reviews.text: My old fish filter started leaking so I purchased another filter (mld) which made my tank water so cloudy, I could not get the water clean. There were two slots where I was able to put a filter in each. As a result of the cloudy water my fish started dying so I purchased the aqua clear filter, the directions were easy and I had it up and running within 20 minutes also this filter is quiet. The next day to my surprise the water was clear. With only one sole survivor (fish) left he or she seems very happy except the fact that his friends died.
customer_reviews.author: QT1007

customer_reviews.title: Watch placement of the layers of filters.
customer_reviews.text: Woke up in the middle of the night because the aquarium didn’t sound right to me. Good thing because the filter was backing up and water was pumping out the back and all over the floor. Leaked out about 15- 20 gallons of water. Ceiling tiles in the basement bowed with water. I cleaned the filter not really dirty and changed all three layers of filters. Seems the top layer the white pellets were puffed and blocking the water flow. I’ve had it one year. Never had this problem. Just beware of placement of the layers in the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki L.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable filter despite thin and brittle housing.
customer_reviews.text: Mine's been running strong for years now with no issues. The filter itself and the sponge-like media cleans and rinses out easy and performs like new after every scrub-down. I have this and an old emperor on the other side of a 125g and the tank has always been crystal. My only complaint is the thin, brittle plastic that was used for the housing and intake tube. I haven't cracked it yet under normal use but it sure seems fragile compared to the ABS plastic (I think) that the emperor was made of.
customer_reviews.author: SuperTurboExtraGnarly

customer_reviews.title: changed my mind.
customer_reviews.text: changed my mind. i left a very positive comment on july. i bought this pump a bit over a month ago. today the pump died while i was away. i lost two fish. how can it happen in such a short time? unreliable quality...
customer_reviews.author: ARBEN CAMAJ

customer_reviews.title: Best HOB money can buy!
customer_reviews.text: Best filters money can buy! These are easily customizable unlike the Seachem filters which are more expensive. These are also quieter and more reliable in my experience. I've ran aquaclear filters for 15yrs, and my first aquaclear filter that I ever bought still works great and runs silent. I run two AC-30's on my daughters 40 gallon that is heavily stocked, I also in one filter I removed the carbon so it holds extra biologiCal media. I will be running two AC-50's on my wife's 60 gallon. The same orientation as my daughters tank. PS. Let your filter run for a month before getting upset they make noise. These filter do need to wear in and establish themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Bill & Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Breakable parts should be packed/held in place...
customer_reviews.text: Really unhappy. I open the box from the sealed plastic and I open it to see the little motor fan loose in the box. I carefully inspect it to make sure not damaged and... lo and behold one of the 4 blades is snapped off. It seems like very flimsy plastic and it was not even packed secure? Come on! Breakable parts should be packed/held in place ESPECIALLY when this fragile.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great Fish Tank Filter
customer_reviews.text: We have the same exact one for our fish tank and it gave out so we needed a replacement. We decided to go with the same exact one and this purchase did not disappoint. Pros: + Price - cheaper than in stores + Noise level is low + Water flows smoothly and the splashes create plenty of oxygen + Easy to clean Areas for Improvement: - None Bottom line - this is a great fish tank filter for 60 to 110 gallons. You won't be disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit over the frame of my Marineland 110 gallon aquarium
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic filter. Super cost effective for the gph you get out of it. I've purchased 2 of them for my 110 gallon goldfish tank and have recommended it to several people. The only problem is...it doesn't fit over the frame of my Marineland 110 gallon tank which is SUPER annoying. My frame is 1/16th of an inch wider than the filter and I really, really don't want to alter the frame of my aquarium. I'll figure something out though because I'm keeping these awesome filters.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Aqua Clear 110
customer_reviews.text: I love these things so much. I have a 20, 50, and the 110 and they are so simple, so quiet, and easy to maintain that i will never by another brand of HOB ever again. You can order replacement parts and can keep these going for years. much quieter than MarineLand filters and so customizable. I would recommend this filter to anyone with a tank smaller than 90 gallons.
customer_reviews.author: Riley M.

customer_reviews.title: Solid but not for large tanks
customer_reviews.text: This filter is easy to setup and I like the 3 stage filtration process. It seems to work well and the price was great BUT it is quite small. Might tank is 30 gallons and the tubes don't reach down near far enough for me even with the included extension. The filter and the tube intake diameter is probably half of my old one. This would be a great filter for a 10 or 20 gallon tank. Although it says 20 to 50 gallons on the label I think 30 gallons might be the limit
customer_reviews.author: roger s

customer_reviews.title: Quiet & Powerful + 3 layers of filtration!
customer_reviews.text: There are many things to like about this HOB filter. If assembled correctly, you will have a super quiet filter, with great power. I love the media compartment - lots of room to choose your own preference for media. I also like the color. It's nice to have something more subtle than the standard black. Mine is for a 10 gallon betta tank, so I do recommend a sponge pre-filter and to adjust the flow to the lowest setting, I also have driftwood at the water flow to help diffuse the current.
customer_reviews.author: John Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Way too noisy, kids can't sleep in bedroom with it running
customer_reviews.text: This thing is way too noisy. It's in the bedroom and my boys cannot sleep. I have to take the lid off because it just rattles and buzzes. Even still with the lid off its very loud. Need to get something else.
customer_reviews.author: K. abberley

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: These are the best as this new one is a an exact replacement of an old one that I managed to crack the main plastic “tank”... however, unlike the old one, this new one was formed without the small “protrusion” on one side (inside) of the “tank” that keeps the whole 3 stage basket from floating up and actually lifting the lid...I would guess its a tooling/mold problem and every now and then I can’t help but think manufacturers/vendors dump off their mistake runs to Amazon (over the whole spectrum of stuff I order and I order quite a lot)
customer_reviews.author: Christian Russell Poulsen

customer_reviews.title: My favorite ever
customer_reviews.text: IMO this is the best HOB, I love that you can control the flow and setting it up is super easy. I have two of these and plan on purchasing more in the future for my other tanks. I purchased the pre filter sponge for my aquaclear 70s and together they work great! I have one going in my 29 gallon (I’m clearly a fan of over filtration) and one in my 40 gallon breeder along with an aqueon quiet flow 20.... It’s highly customizable as far as filter media goes and I can’t imagine ever switching to something else.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Broken filter boxes - deceptive sales and faulty shipping
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two aqua-clear 110s and both arrived from amazon with cracked and broken filter boxes. Needed these immediatly for new tanks. One even appeared to have been used, based on all the scratches on the filter-box and lid. Then amazon gives me the runaround and difficult process of having to return these in order to receive replacements. Despite explaining to amazon that there isnt an easy way get them back to amazon. What a disgrace. All i want and needed is urgent replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: What are the odds?
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I'm giving it two stars. Aqua clear products are usually A1 supplies, but this filter just stopped working after using it for about 6 weeks. Using in a saltwater tank as directed. 3 layer filtration. The return window closed on August 20th. So now I'm stuck with no filter. Luckily the tank is still cycling and no fish will suffer because of this. Pretty bummed out. I use aqua clear filters on all my other tanks and have for years...
customer_reviews.author: aleigha moss

customer_reviews.title: SECOND IN A ROW THAT I'VE OWNED - GOOD PERFORMANCE
customer_reviews.text: I bought a well-used aquarium with one of these. It worked well, but I'd have to tweak the impeller with a fingertip to get 'er spinning after shutting down for cleaning. It was probably fine for years to come, but I bought another just to be on the safe side. Keeps the tank sparkling clean - just add additional filter media to get the small particles. You can buy sheets of blue filter media and cut pieces or just use the white cotton stuffing that you get at craft stores for pillows or teddy bears - that stuff doesn't miss a bit! Highly recommended product.
customer_reviews.author: AMAZONIAN

customer_reviews.title: This is awful
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this as a replacement. All I've had with it is problems. Lid constantly popping up and one morning wake up to running water spilling out from top all over...good thing I was home. If not, 20 gallons of water would have been all over my floor. After that I through in garbage and went back to my old filter.
customer_reviews.author: denise566

customer_reviews.title: My fish love the biomax filter
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice and quiet filter. Be aware, my pump stopped working after eight months. I spoke with customer service who instructed me too unscrew the battery pack off the bottom of the unit and pull out the impeller. if the magnet underneath the impeller gets coated with slime, it will not work. Simply clean it off and re-insert. Then it works fine. The upkeep on this is a little more expensive than a standard carbon filter, because you additionally have to buy the sponges and the bio max packs. They aren’t too expensive and I think it’s worth it for the fish.
customer_reviews.author: Clark G

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Over the side filter
customer_reviews.text: I am running this on a 20 gallon saltwater tank with excellent results. I do have a lite bio load with 4 fish and a starfish and this filter maintains the water clarity beautifully. The best thing about this filter and all of the Aqua clear over the side filters is you can add and change the type of filtration to suit your needs. I removed the carbon and added more bio balls. Possibilities are endless you tube for more information. Over all a quiet and efficient filter
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy B

customer_reviews.title: Tank 4.5" from wall.
customer_reviews.text: I love this aquaclear 70. I am using it on a 29 gallon tank. The current of the return is not too strong. The water is filtered nice and is extremely clear. I have a planted tank so I did not use the carbon pack. I bought a 2nd ac 70 white filter sponge and I use 2 sponges and the bio rings. I love that this filter is not made to use cartridges. It's made to be customized and modified! I was worried about the size of the gap between the tank and the wall. I don't even notice it anymore. My tank is 4.5" from the wall with a tiny gap between the filter and wall.
customer_reviews.author: big red

customer_reviews.title: Quit working
customer_reviews.text: Was really excited about this based on some the the reviews I had read. I did like the amount of space it had for filter media but it stopped working after only 3 weeks of running. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a amazing so far
customer_reviews.text: So I started off with a TopFinn filter for my new 55 gallon tank and it was so noisy I wanted to kill myself just listening to it. I read a bunch of reviews online and decided to give this a shot and boy am I glad I did. It is so quiet and I love the way you can customize the filter materials. I have an Oscar and feed him small minnows and he leaves a dead body here and there. I had two dead minnows on the other side of the tank and the filter was able to suck them up. I am very impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Williams

customer_reviews.title: The name says it all....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put on my Top Fin 10 gallon. We weren't able to keep the water clear with the filter that came with the tank, so I did some research and found this one. The cycle restarted when we put the new filter on, so there was the usual bacteria bloom. However, it didn't take long and our water became absolutely crystal clear. We love this filter. We are going to be upgrading our 10g to a 40 or 55g and we will definitely get another Aqua Clear filter for that tank too.
customer_reviews.author: veronica2311

customer_reviews.title: Great HOB Filter
customer_reviews.text: I use the Aquaclear 50 on my 36 bow front mixed reef and it works great. If I had to purchase again I would get the larger AQ70. The unit is very quiet, the only sound you hear is the water flow back into the tank. The media chamber is large and allows you to customize what you want to put in there. I run a sponge block, filter floss, and a bag of Chemipure Blue. The filter comes apart easily for cleaning, and the flow rate is adjustable. There are "mods" you can do to quiet the water discharge back into the tank using a plastic cup or water bottle. I would definately buy this HOB again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic filter
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic filter. I've had the bio wheel in the past but found them noisy and hard to restart after a power outage. The a Aquaclear is easy to set up and maintain. Its easy to get the components out and clean them vs. having to pay for expensive filters. The components. i.e. sponge, charcoal filter etc. last between 1 to 2 months and don't break the bank when you need to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: SkunkLover27

customer_reviews.title: very quiet and quickly clears up a tank with a nice amount of oxygen going to the bottom
customer_reviews.text: great filter! called customer service to ask questions and they were able to answer all my questions and helped me understand the best way to get my tank under control again. this is a much better filter than the one that came with the tank. water is crystal clear now and ammonia is back down to zero. I like that I can simply swap out the middle section from carbon to ammonia reducer. I experimented with how much water to leave from the top and this filter works well even if the tank is filled to the top or 6 inches from the top. I am glad i decided to get this one.
customer_reviews.author: James O'Hare

customer_reviews.title: Motor did not last! Died at four months of use
customer_reviews.text: Products works beautifully as designed. Low noise and great filtration. Loved how well it kept my tank clean and fish happy. Con - motor died after only four months. Was running the 5-20 system on a 13 gallon tank so it’s disappointing that it’s life span was only four months. I’m wondering if amazon was stocking old product as they have now changed packaging and name to Fluval. Had to replace so bought the new one at a local petco. I will update my review after a few months
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: It’s quiet, unassuming, and performs well.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only been using it for 10 days but it’s amazing, I was replacing a little 10 gallon whisper quiet that submerged in the water. Now I have the 30 Aquaclear my 10 gallon. It’s not disturbing the water excessively or throwing my fish around haha; You can see the big bubbles it’s making though. I can’t hear the motor at all, just the sound of the trickling water. My ammonia and nitrate levels are 0. So glad i bought this filter.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Favorite HOB filter
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. I have 2 on my tanks as well as 2 of the 70 gallon ones on other tanks. I use polyfil in them as media rather than the actual filter media that comes with it.......but they're great filters. They keep the water clear. I even had an algae bloom in my 75G tank and after adding on the aquaclear filter onto it......took care of it right away with the polyfil. Sometimes they're a bit loud......which I'm not 100% sure why because it usually goes away after a day or so.
customer_reviews.author: JoshM5683

customer_reviews.title: Not for us
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this just isn't for us. We have had it for about a month. Our tank gets cloudy and dirty faster than ever since switching to this filter. Water changes used to be every 10-14 days but now I can barely make it to 7 before I can barely see my fish. Not sure what's different between ours and the other great reviews but I think we'll just save this for a smaller tank one day and go back to our old filter. On a positive note, it's extremely quiet. Set up and maintenance are both very quick and simple.
customer_reviews.author: kyrstin

customer_reviews.title: My old filter was failing and barely able to filter ...
customer_reviews.text: My old filter was failing and barely able to filter much water. I had just completed cycling my tank and stocking it and the failing pump wasn’t passing enough water through the filter jeopardizing the nitrifying bacteria population risking an emergency crash in water quality. I was able to order this replacement pump, received it overnight, and was able to remove the current media chamber from the old pump, quickly place into the new one, plug it in and it’s working perfectly. This is the exact same filter that came with my Fluval Edge except it instead of having “Fluval” on the cover, it has “Aqua Clear”.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pieper

customer_reviews.title: Overall Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I like my new filter. I've used it for almost 2 months now. The suction is satisfactory. When I first installed it - it sucked up everything! Now some areas further away from the filter I see pockets of poop/food that is not being moved. I'm not sure why but when I break it up the debris gets pulled up. For the most part I am very satisfied. With a full tank, the noise level is low, but the lower the water level goes, the louder the noise gets - easy fix. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Camille H. Page

customer_reviews.title: This has done a much better job of keeping my 10 gallon tank clean than ...
customer_reviews.text: This has done a much better job of keeping my 10 gallon tank clean than the old whisper filter that it replaced. The water is much clearer now. Only real problem is that it can get a bit noisy. It's not as bad the the Aquaclear 70 I have on my big tank, but it's still noticeable. After a few days though, it fades into background noise and I stopped noticing it. Update: after several months of use the sound has died down to nothing. Sometimes I have to check to see if it's still on. If only my big tank filter would do the same....
customer_reviews.author: Ember's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: The Best and Easiest To Clean HOB
customer_reviews.text: The easiest Hang on back filter to clean. One problem is that they get older the impeller needs to be cleaned each time to start it up. I solve the problem by poking the blades on the impeller with an impeller brush. I like that you can fill it with what ever media you want. I like using carbon to clear and make the water less potent to my nose. I use polyester filling, the sponge and bio rings, lava rocks, or bio noodles. One thing to keep in mind is that aquaclear by Hagen was bought by fluval so the Aquaclear parts are fluval products so Fluval Aquaclear it is the same as Aquaclear.
customer_reviews.author: buddy

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to set up, quiet and efficient. Lots of room for your own filter media (I never use carbon filters (bad)). Easy for maintenance. I was skeptical at first because it has a rather primitive flow control, but it works great. Not sure why people are saying it's loud, it is absolutely silent. It helps to add in some water to the filter tank when first starting to help it prime. I would/will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Albatross

customer_reviews.title: Heavily scratched!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered this filter before just a smaller size and it arrived brand new and worked great. Still works great. For some reason I ordered a larger filter this time and it arrived heavily scratched and it looked worn. It was supposed to be new. I’m returning it for another one and hopefully it will come new like the last one. I have this one 3 stars because the issue seemed cosmetic only and the filter would have worked but I didn’t want to chance it.
customer_reviews.author: Prince E.

customer_reviews.title: Loud and noisy sound
customer_reviews.text: Good designed for water flow and filter but horrible loud and noisy sound. Even my betta stay still not swimming and curious the sound. I don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Great filter!
customer_reviews.text: *I changed my review from 5 to 4 stars because less than 6 months after buying this one I came home to no filter running and the motor is so hot there's no doubt it has burned up. Second one I have is still working.* It arrived broken and a replacement was here within a few days. Aside from that, this filter has been nothing but impressive. It's rather easy to use with the Polyfil I use for sponge replacement and being clear makes it super handy when needing to see if the media needs replacing. Love it! So much nicer and easier on the eyes than standard black filters.
customer_reviews.author: Britney D

customer_reviews.title: Great for 5 galleon tank
customer_reviews.text: I've over the moon and so is my betta who is more perky since he got a water-fall. I haven't bothered to install the filters as the tank is easy enough to empty and refill every 2 weeks.I can put in some females now if i want as they are more fragile. The strength of the fall is easily adjusted with a rudder. I have it on the slowest that's a perfect flow for 5 gal tank. No problems about bettas getting minced by its workings.
customer_reviews.author: Rapunzael

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, Noisy, Noisy!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Received these on December 24th. I will be sending back December 26th. Purchased 2 of these and both have a rattle to them even with tops off. The motors are noisier than the cheap Top Fin that came with my 55 gallon aquarium kit. Also 1 of the filters seemed to have been previously used, it was filthy. I am limited on the length of a HOB filter I can get cause of my hoods. These have pretty good reviews from Aquarium websites, but they are terribly noisy. They also are a very tight fit on rimed glass tanks. Avoid these and look for another option.
customer_reviews.author: mindy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great filter, well built, quiet, and very powerful. It gives out great flow and quickly filters an aquarium. Works well in salt water and is very easy to clean. Great buy! I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Great HOB filter, but LOUD
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this filter. It was so easy to set up in less than 5 minutes and the power is great for my 29 gallon. I added an intake sponge as well and the suction is still great. The reason for 4 stars is the noise level. The lid of this unit causes some vibration noises and sometimes it gets a little annoying. You cannot hear it more than 10 feet away. If you take the lid off, it is near silent. I wouldn't say this is a bad thing, but if you hate small vibration noises, this may be an issue for you. For me, I just deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great HOB Filter
customer_reviews.text: After much research on HOB filters, I purchased this filter to replace a Penguin 200. AquaClear is exponentially more quiet, and I love the flexibility to customize the media. I have it in a 29-gallon tank with a school of 8 lamp-eye tetras and plastic plants. Keeps the aquarium pristine-clean. Very easy to set up and use. It works like a mini canister filtration system, which I decided against because of their complexity.
customer_reviews.author: Nightsky127

customer_reviews.title: You Won't Be Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from the picture, I'm using 4 of the 70's for my 55 gallon cichlid tank. All of them are quiet, reliable, and powerful. I was going to purchase 2 110's, but decided I could get a little bit more media space with the 70's. That also goes for total water turnover in the tank. 1200 gph vs 1000. I've been using aquaclears filters for my other 2 tanks for years. Compared to other hob filters, these are the most customizable filters available.
customer_reviews.author: fugley4651

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - stopped working after only a few months of use
customer_reviews.text: At first I was very excited for this product, however after a few months of use it has completely stopped working. I have changed the filters, checked that all components are clean and clear, however it does not respond at all after plugging in. I am not sure how to even contact the manufacturer in order to receive a replacement or to get it fixed. Disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: H.K.

customer_reviews.title: Louder than the 30 on low settings
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th AquaClear filter, fish 50 version. The box came in as expected wrapped and orderly. However after opening it I noticed some abnormalities, scuffing on the plastic, propeler and plastic housing were not fixed in as the others. Not to worry I'm familiar with the system and after adding the prop and securing the plastic above it the filter seems to operating. On max speed it works great. However it starts to rattle quite loudly when on low settings. Not sure if this is normal of the 50 gal.
customer_reviews.author: JoskoRenkins

customer_reviews.title: can pump water out of your tank
customer_reviews.text: this filter worked great for a year and know i have problems with it pumping water out of my tank onto the floor. If it gets the slightest bit dirty it can cause the water to overflow from the back of the filter. buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Motors don't last
customer_reviews.text: Even with weekly cleaning, the motor burnt out in under three months. Brought a replacement motor (another $40), and it lasted less than three weeks. I just don't understand how they can charge this much for such absolute junk.
customer_reviews.author: TK Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Good filter at first, but it didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the filter in January, and it seemed fine, it never was very quiet, but it filtered ok. It is easy to clean, but if you are just changing media it will let the trash from the filter back into the tank, and will take a day or two to clear up. 10 months later the impeller is wore out, and is even noisier than normal. I have looked into getting a new impeller, but i read some reviews, and they never seem to receive the correct size. If you are looking for a good queit filter, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Etheridge

customer_reviews.title: Best.Filters.Ever
customer_reviews.text: I've used aqua clear filters for over 40 years. They're the best hang on back filters ever. Period. They're relatively quiet, have physical, chemical and biological media, self-prime and just run and run and run and run. They can be used right out of the box for most aquaria and can even be modded into reef tank filters and refugia. Did I mention they run forever?
customer_reviews.author: Aiptasia

customer_reviews.title: I love this filter!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a very good filter. I use another brand on my other tank and was thinking of switching over so I tried it on my new tank I setup as a trial. It is much quieter, filters the water better, has an adjustable flow rate that is great, and has effective mio media. I will be switching the filter on my other tank for sure.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Developed a leak at motor housing
customer_reviews.text: After almost a year of owning this filter, I noticed I needed to add water every couple of days. After the 2nd or 3rd time I inspected and found water dripping ever so slowly from the motor housing. In all my years of owning aquariums I have never had a filter fail like this. I so wanted to like this filter, and it came with great recommendations, but I can't trust I won't have this issue again.
customer_reviews.author: Keith G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would of choose this from the beginning. I used a whisper that worked great on my smaller tank but when I got a larger tank, it didn’t seem to do the job. I always wanted a filter like this and tried others but they were to noisy. Granted, this is noisy compared to the wisper but it does a great job
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Simply doesn’t  stand the test of time
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Aquaclear pump in 6 months. They simply do not last. I have made sure never to run it dry, tried talking to it, prayed to god, but in the end the pump stops working after a couple of months. They are cheap, I suppose you get what you pay for. The next time the pump goes out I’ll switch to a different product. The only reason I stuck with this brand for so long because the pump demensions fit my application well. However, I’m going to have to figure out something else because this is starting to get ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Shey

customer_reviews.title: Loud motor! Terrible customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible motor on this filter and terrible customer service. Bought it for a 50 gal tank in my room and after one day it was extremely noisy. I did everything I could to the impellor, I cleaned it, I put silcone greese on it and nothing worked! Contacted the company and they sent me a new impellor. New impellor did absolutely nothing and the filter is still very loud. Contacted the company again and they told me to ship them the motor which cost 8$! They sent me a new motor and impellor and it's even noisier then I first started! Do not buy if you are looking for a quiet filter there are better options!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second time this filter broke!
customer_reviews.text: My first filter stopped working after a short time. It was replaced immediately, but today the second one stopped working as well. So sick of this filter. Like I said before thank goodness I have another filter working. Now tomorrow I will have to spend more money for another one! I'm so miffed!
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Best Hang on Back Filter on the Market!
customer_reviews.text: I kept hearing about how good these are, and so I purchased the Aquaclear 20 for my 20 gallon long shrimp tank. I REALLY love the design, the amount of media it holds, the quietness, the ability to control and adjust the flow and the sleek look. Only thing I added was a sponge on the intake to protect shrimplets. I highly recommend this filter!
customer_reviews.author: TW Chisolm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product & super quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my Tetra Whisper that just died after less than a year & it was extremely loud. When this arrived I set it up on my 55 gallon aquarium & had to double check to see if it was running because it is so quiet! I have another one on my other tank that has given me zero problems for 4 years & I'm so glad I spent the extra money to get this one again because it's been reliable & quiet. My parameters have all been great & keeps the tank looking crystal clear! Very easy to clean & use!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and effective filter
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice, quiet, and easy to maintain hanging filter for a small aquarium. I have mine on a well-planted 20 gallon low tech freshwater aquarium and I couldn't be happier. I chose to eliminate the charcoal and replace it with a second biofilter to increase the biofiltration capacity. In addition, I have used a sponge on the uptake tube without any loss of power/suction. The pump primes easily and quickly if you fill the filter with water. The impeller is very quiet. We hear the water more than the motor. This is a filter I could have in my bedroom and not be disturbed.
customer_reviews.author: M Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great until it broke
customer_reviews.text: This pump was great until it broke after 5 months. Requires 3 different filters which Is a pain but keeps the tank clean and pretty well balanced. I’m buying it again and hoping that it lasts longer than 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: O.

customer_reviews.title: Stands up!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one Oct 2018. It's still quiet, easy to clean, and has caused me none of the problems the AC70 does. This is the only AC that I recommend, now. I've bought about 7 of the AC70's and they're all being replaced. I wanted it on my 29, but it only fit right on my 55 or else I'd have bought another to stick on that tank!
customer_reviews.author: AkrBn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent filters
customer_reviews.text: Augh, I could geek out for paragraphs about how superb these filters are. They run quiet, they're easy to clean, they last a super long time -- the only ones that have died on us over the years have been due to sand accidentally makings its way in there, or once we had the power go out while we weren't home, and only some of the filters managed to re-prime and get themselves going again. As long as you prime carefully before plugging in, they should work without a hitch and give you years of quiet filtration.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design, always getting clogged up
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design. I thought the water would bubble up or through the filter media like most filters, but no. The just pumps the water over the very top of the filter and therefore there isnt much interaction with the filter. Also the intake gets clogged up way too easy. Had to clean it sometimes twice weak just to keep in functioning. Terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: So Far Aqua Clear is the best filter I found.
customer_reviews.text: After trial and error, I found the best filter. I tried other hanging filters and canister filters and they were subpar in their performance. I'm glad I found this Aqua Clear which made my water almost crystal clear in a few hours. I noticed some reviewers were complaining about the noise level but my 70 is fairly quiet and has great water flow. Give Aqua Clear a shot. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A V

customer_reviews.title: I am SO MAD
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on July 11, 2019 at the price of $34.99. DIE ON AUGUST 30, 2019 @ 9:20 pm. I unplugged the filter and went on my merry way doing a late night water change (it’s friday, after all!). Thirty minutes later.. nothing. I will say rest in piece because I’m about to throw it out a window... I know- I’m upset- but come on! I loved this thing and now I have to hope my baby fish do okay until I can get a replacement. If I return it to the company and wait for a new one, they’re gona be long dead. Like this filter. Dead. 6 weeks.. really? That’s all it lasted. I could cry.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Mich

customer_reviews.title: Good little filter for your money.
customer_reviews.text: Saw some folks saying its loud I gotta say I'm not having that issue at all its probably a little quieter than my old one if anything. You gotta put it together which isn't too hard instructions are easy to read and follow. I have it in a 10 gallon tank and it's doing well so far it really filters a lot of water cleared up my water which was a little cloudy.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Star

customer_reviews.title: Best filter in my opinion!!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this filter, I already had one in my other tank. I was using a MarineLand Penguin 200, Power Filter, 30 to 50-Gallon, 200 GPH I had bought a while back, but I decided to get another filter, so I chose one I already knew that was great. The marineland filter, was such a pain in the rear!!!! It was all the time making a bunch of noise, and I couldn't ever get the propeller in it to sit right. Anyway, back on track, of course this filter is the best... Everyone knows that 😏
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: If your debating on getting the 10-30 gal filter or this one . Get the 10-30 and spend the extra buck. This one does not do the job properly. I have 2 10 gallon tanks with the same fish in both tanks and a 10-30 gallon filter and the other with this filTee and this one never keeps the water clean and always cloudy and gooey substance In the water
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: AWFUL product poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This was 2nd Aqua Clear filter purchased Nov 3, 2019 cost was $68.47. Worked 5 months. This order replaced another Aqua Clear that was purchased Aug 5, 2019 cost was $85.59 which worked 3 months. Gave the benefit of the doubt that I just got a faulty one but not anymore! I have to get another filter fast but I will not purchase another Aqua Clear. I have had aquariums for years and never had this problem with filters before.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super Clear Filter
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a cheaper type of filter and I used to have to clean the water constantly. I upgraded to the Aquaclear, paid twice as much for the filter, and so glad I did. This filter keeps the water crystal clear. No more cleaning every week. Spend the money and you and your fish will be happy!
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: Great filter!!!!!  Probably the best hang on back that exists!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutly amazing filter. Fluval bought out aquaclear maybe 10 years ago. Aquaclear us a great filter. Doesn't use stupid blue cartridges, but a large block of replaceable, cleanable, and effective foam for a filter. I've made a single foam filter last almost 2 years with regular cleaning. When replacing, they are very cheap. 2-3 bucks a piece
customer_reviews.author: Gamikatsu

customer_reviews.title: mine was faulty
customer_reviews.text: my filter came and had a crack in it, it may have been ups fault as the box was a bit banged up. But as this is the 2nd one ive owned i really like how good this is for my 10g tank, waterflow isnt too strong for smaller fish and its so quiet. Customer service hel;ped me with a refund for the damaged one, great sellers
customer_reviews.author: The Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Too much work when changing the inside components
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with the filter but not with the three different components that need to go into it. I'm used to just using the charcoal pack that is ready to slide into the filter chamber. But there is a sponge, the charcoal and some rocks that need to be put into a net that I almost didn't see because it had to be pulled apart before the rocks can be put in it. Then the closure didn't work so I just tied the top of it off.
customer_reviews.author: G. Beckett

customer_reviews.title: Usually good, this one wasn't.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this filter for a couple of years and had problems with noise the entire time. I have six aquaclear filters on various aquariums and this one always makes noise. It's a constant rattling sound. It also didn't come with the little black thing you pit in the bottom to prop up against the back of the aquarium. I have tried different things and none of them work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Motor burned out within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This is our 5th Aquaclear, and the 2nd failure. We've had every size, and thus far, the most recent 2 have had motor burn outs within 2-3 months of purchase. They are cleaned out weekly and bi-weekly. We had better luck with ones purchased a couple years ago; not sure if manufacturing tolerances have changed, or the motor manufacturer with whom they contract, has changed- will be purchasing a different manufacturer today and in the future.
customer_reviews.author: pine y. tree

product_meta.title: Aqua Clear - Fish Tank Filter
product_meta.description: Size:60 to 110 Gallons - 110| Style:Fish Tank FilterThe Aqua Clear Power Filter represents one of the most versatile hang-on filter systems available. The five models available provide a complete selection of flow rates for the most popular sizes of aquariums. The filter’s unique design allows for up to six times more media volume and the longest water to media contact time in the industry. The Aqua Clear 110 Power Filter features a unique multi-stage filtration system that provides complete mechanical, chemical as well as biological filter media for superior water quality. The Power Filter has a filtration volume that is up to 7 times larger than comparable filters. It also allows superior contact time with Aqua Clear filter media. The filter preserves beneficial bacterial creating a stress-free environment for fish aquarium inhabitants (freshwater fish and live aquarium plants) and maintaining clear aquarium water. Its unique waterfall design enables filtered water to return to the tank silently, gently breaking the surface tension and creating beneficial oxygenation. The Power Filter’s patented flow control feature allows you to adjust the water flow according to your aquarium needs. The media basket prevents water from by-passing the filter media, maximizing filtration efficiency. Installation and maintenance are quick, easy, and convenient. The filter comes equipped with Aqua Clear Foam, Activated Carbon Filter and Aqua Clear BioMax. Aqua Clear offers an extensive line of media, including Zeo-Carb and Ammonia Remover, exclusively designed for the Aqua Clear 110 Power Filter. Aqua Clear creates a wide variety of products for freshwater tanks that can be used as fish tank accessories, fish tank decorations, and aquarium filter media that is perfect for large and small fish tanks. The Aqua Clear 110 Power Filter is ideal for 60 gallon fish tank to 110 U.S gallons (227 to 416 L) fresh water tanks. Maximum Output: 500 U.S. Gal./h (1890 L/h)
feature_bullets: Aquarium refiltration system that offers superior contact time with filter media and energy efficient pump lowers operating costs
Quick and easy installation, we recommend that you clean aquarium filter every two weeks for maximum operation and efficiency
Provides optimal mechanical, chemical, and biological filtrations
Comes equipped with AquaClear Foam, Activated Carbon Filter and BioMax and Cycle Guard for superior water quality
Filtration volume is up to 7 times larger than comparable fish tank filters
Lifetime warranty; ideal for aquariums up to 110 gallons

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
